item.title: Thinking in React
item.description:
How does React re-rendering work and when does react re-render a component? Let’s dive into it with some fun examples!

React re-rendering

React re-renders a component when either of the following happens:

  1. The component’s props change.
  2. The component’s state changes.
  3. The component’s parent component re-renders.

The key thing to note here is that React does a shallow comparison of props, so passing a new object or function reference triggers a re-render even if the values inside are identical.

What is type coercion?

There are 6 primitive data types in JavaScript: undefined, Boolean, Number, String, BigInt and Symbol. When you try to do things like adding two different data types together, JavaScript uses some rules to decide how it’s gonna coerce one type into the other type, to actually add them together.
